content.raw:
Hi Achim,

thanks for the feedback. I'm trying to figure this out, but not sure where to look right now. The installer works on the only Win7 x64 machine we can try it on at the moment, and it also has Python 2.7.5 installed.

Does the problem only occur with the latest version of the installer? I added the previous one back on the PyPI page.

[Here](http://stackoverflow.com/a/14339295/1258041) is another thing we can try to diagnose this (we'll try it with your dump file here).

content.raw:
I tried the installer on another Win7 x64 machine, with an older Python 2.7.2, and it also worked.

The output I managed to get from the debugger doesn't help me that much: http://pastebin.com/AUQtfjYF

To be on the safe side: can you verify that your Python folder is writeable? Seems to be unrelated, but this was mentioned as a possible cause of problems with distutils-built installers on Windows in some of the search results I got.
content.html:
I tried the installer on another Win7 x64 machine, with an older Python 2.7.2, and it also worked.

The output I managed to get from the debugger doesn't help me that much: http://pastebin.com/AUQtfjYF

To be on the safe side: can you verify that your Python folder is writeable? Seems to be unrelated, but this was mentioned as a possible cause of problems with distutils-built installers on Windows in some of the search results I got.

content.raw:
Also, did you use these installers before on this machine? If so, can you try a version that you know worked to see if it still does (if the 2.1.5 is not such a version)?

In the meantime, you can install from source via `pip`.
content.html:
Also, did you use these installers before on this machine? If so, can you try a version that you know worked to see if it still does (if the 2.1.5 is not such a version)?

In the meantime, you can install from source via pip.

Many thanks, 
Achim

content.raw:
Hi Achim,

thanks for checking back. I asked a couple of questions in the two comments above; they can clarify if the problem is with your installation or with the installer files. Also I built another installer executable with the newest distutils, you can try running that one: [PyPI](https://pypi.python.org/packages/2.7/p/pyteomics/pyteomics-2.1.6.win-amd64_py2.7.5.exe#md5=7e4c4d3bdaa440b8883cd19a74cee493). Would be interesting to know if it crashes or not on your machine (works fine here).

Regards, Lev
